<li id="cite_note-391"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-391">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFColby2008">Colby, Frederick S. (6 August 2008). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=sasZCjcTisIC&amp;pg=PA15" rel="nofollow"><i>Narrating Muhammad's Night Journey: Tracing the Development of the Ibn 'Abbas Ascension Discourse</i></a>. SUNY Press. p.Â 15. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>Â <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-7914-7788-5" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-7914-7788-5"><bdi>978-0-7914-7788-5</bdi></a>. <q>From the earliest extant Muslim texts, it becomes clear that a group of Muslims from the beginning interpreted the 'furthest place of prayer' (al-masjid al-aqá¹£Ä) with the city of Jerusalem in general and its Herodian/Solomonic Temple in particular... Eventually, a general consensus formed around the idea that Muhammad's journey did indeed take him to Jerusalem.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Narrating+Muhammad%27s+Night+Journey%3A+Tracing+the+Development+of+the+Ibn+%27Abbas+Ascension+Discourse&amp;rft.pages=15&amp;rft.pub=SUNY+Press&amp;rft.date=2008-08-06&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-7914-7788-5&amp;rft.aulast=Colby&amp;rft.aufirst=Frederick+S.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DsasZCjcTisIC%26pg%3DPA15&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AJerusalem"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-392"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-392">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://haditsbukharionline.blogspot.ca/2010/11/merits-of-helpers-in-madinah-ansaar.html" rel="nofollow">"Merits of the Helpers in Madinah (Ansaar) â Hadith Sahih Bukhari"</a>. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">7 December</span> 2012</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Merits+of+the+Helpers+in+Madinah+%28Ansaar%29+%E2%80%93+Hadith+Sahih+Bukhari&amp;rft.pub=Haditsbukharionline.blogspot.ca&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fhaditsbukharionline.blogspot.ca%2F2010%2F11%2Fmerits-of-helpers-in-madinah-ansaar.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AJerusalem"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-393"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-393">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFHughes2014"><a href="/wiki/Aaron_W._Hughes" title="Aaron W. Hughes">Hughes, Aaron W.</a> (2014). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=nWV_BAAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA45" rel="nofollow"><i>Theorizing Islam: Disciplinary Deconstruction and Reconstruction</i></a>. Religion in Culture. Taylor &amp; Francis. p.Â 45. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>Â <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-317-54594-1" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-317-54594-1"><bdi>978-1-317-54594-1</bdi></a>. <q>Although later commentators would debate whether or not this journey was a physical one or took place at an internal level, it would come to play a crucial role in establishing Muhammad's prophetic credentials. In the first part of this journey, referred to as the isra, he traveled from the Kaba in Mecca to "the farthest mosque" (al-masjid al-aqsa), identified with the Temple Mount in Jerusalem: the al-Aqsa mosque that stands there today eventually took its name from this larger precinct, in which it was constructed.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Theorizing+Islam%3A+Disciplinary+Deconstruction+and+Reconstruction&amp;rft.series=Religion+in+Culture&amp;rft.pages=45&amp;rft.pub=Taylor+%26+Francis&amp;rft.date=2014&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-317-54594-1&amp;rft.aulast=Hughes&amp;rft.aufirst=Aaron+W.&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DnWV_BAAAQBAJ%26pg%3DPA45&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AJerusalem"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-394"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-394">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www.al-islam.org/al-miraj" rel="nofollow">"Me'raj â The Night Ascension"</a>. <li id="cite_note-396"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-396">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20100712140230/http://www.travelandleisure.com/worldsbest/2010/cities/africa-middle-east-cities/15" rel="nofollow">"World's Best Awards 2010 â Africa and the Middle East"</a>. </div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="background-color:#dcf5dc;;width:1%">Celestial<br/> bodies</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd" style="width:100%;padding:0;background-color:#ffffff;"><div style="padding:0 0.25em"><i>Maá¹£ÄbÄ«á¸¥</i> (literally 'lamps'):
<ul><li><i>Al-Qamar</i> (The Moon)</li>
<li><i>KawÄkib</i> (Planets)
<ul><li><i>Al-Ará¸</i> (The Earth)</li></ul></li>
<li><i>NujÅ«m</i> (Stars)
<ul><li><i>Ash-Shams</i> (The Sun)</li></ul></li></ul></div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="background-color:#dcf5dc;;width:1%">Plant matter</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-even" style="width:100%;padding:0;background-color:#f7fdf7;"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<li><i>Baá¹£al</i> (Onion)</li>
<li><i>FÅ«m</i> (Garlic or wheat)</li>
<li><i>Shaá¹­Ê¾</i> (Shoot)</li>
<li><i>SÅ«q</i> (Plant stem)</li>
<li><i>ZarÊ¿</i> (Seed)</li>
</div><table class="nowraplinks navbox-subgroup" style="border-spacing:0"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="background-color:#dcf5dc;;width:1%">Fruits</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd" style="width:100%;padding:0;background-color:#ffffff;"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">

<div class="navbox-styles nomobile"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1061467846" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></div><div aria-labelledby="Journeys_of_Paul_the_Apostle" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks mw-collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-title" colspan="2" scope="col"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Journeys_of_Paul_of_Tarsus" title="Template:Journeys of Paul of Tarsus"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Journeys_of_Paul_of_Tarsus" title="Template talk:Journeys of Paul of Tarsus"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Journeys_of_Paul_of_Tarsus&amp;action=edit"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div><div id="Journeys_of_Paul_the_Apostle" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em">Journeys of <a href="/wiki/Paul_the_Apostle" title="Paul the Apostle">Paul the Apostle</a></div></th></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">First journey</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li>1. <a href="/wiki/Antioch" title="Antioch">Antioch</a></li>
<li>2. <a href="/wiki/Seleucia_Pieria" title="Seleucia Pieria">Seleucia</a></li>
<li>3. <a href="/wiki/Cyprus" title="Cyprus">Cyprus</a></li>

<li>4. <a href="/wiki/Perga" title="Perga">Perga</a></li>

<li>6. <a href="/wiki/Konya" title="Konya">Konya</a> (Iconium)</li>

<li>9. <a href="/wiki/Antalya" title="Antalya">Antalya</a></li>

</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">Second journey</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-even hlist" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">

<li><b><a href="/wiki/Sukhumi" title="Sukhumi">Sukhumi</a></b>, <i><a href="/wiki/Abkhazia" title="Abkhazia">Abkhazia</a></i> <b>*</b></li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Tbilisi" title="Tbilisi">Tbilisi</a></b>, <a href="/wiki/Georgia_(country)" title="Georgia (country)">Georgia</a></li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Tehran" title="Tehran">Tehran</a></b>, <a href="/wiki/Iran" title="Iran">Iran</a></li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Tskhinvali" title="Tskhinvali">Tskhinvali</a></b>, <i><a href="/wiki/South_Ossetia" title="South Ossetia">South Ossetia</a></i> <b>*</b></li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Yerevan" title="Yerevan">Yerevan</a></b>, <a href="/wiki/Armenia" title="Armenia">Armenia</a></li></ul>
</div></td></tr></tbody></table></div></td></tr><tr><td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="2" style="padding:0.5em 0 0.3em; line-height:1.3em;"><div><b>*</b> Disputed. See: <a href="/wiki/Chagos_Archipelago_sovereignty_dispute" title="Chagos Archipelago sovereignty dispute">Chagos Archipelago sovereignty dispute</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Cyprus_dispute" title="Cyprus dispute">Cyprus dispute</a>, <a href="/wiki/Status_of_Jerusalem" title="Status of Jerusalem">Status of Jerusalem</a>, <a href="/wiki/Nagorno-Karabakh_conflict" title="Nagorno-Karabakh conflict">Artsakh-Azerbaijani conflict</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Abkhaz-Georgian_conflict" title="Abkhaz-Georgian conflict">Abkhaz-Georgian conflict</a> and <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Georgian-Ossetian_conflict" title="Georgian-Ossetian conflict">Georgian-Ossetian conflict</a></div></td></tr></tbody></table></div>

<h2>Navigation menu</h2>
<div id="mw-head">
<nav aria-labelledby="p-personal-label" class="vector-menu mw-portlet mw-portlet-personal vector-user-menu-legacy" id="p-personal" role="navigation">
<h3 class="vector-menu-heading" id="p-personal-label">
<span class="vector-menu-heading-label">Personal tools</span>
</h3>
<div class="vector-menu-content">
